title: Titchmarsh Nature Reserve Walking Route

images.title: RedCitrus / Titchmarsh Nature Reserve, Thrapston
images.caption: View across the former gravel pits which now form Titchmarsh Nature Reserve.

images.title: Michael Trolove / Bird Hide at Titchmarsh Nature Reserve
images.caption: Bird Hide at the reserve

images.title: Michael Trolove / Nene Bridge
images.caption: Nene Bridge. This new build bridge allows access to the nature reserve from the byway from Titchmarsh.

description: Enjoy waterside walking in this nature reserve in Thrapston, near Kettering. There are several large lakes to stroll around and you can also follow the Nene Way along the River Nene which runs through the reserve. Large numbers of wildfowl can be seen on the water including heron, goosander, wigeon, gadwal, reed warbler and sedge warbler. Along the river Nene you can look out for butterflies, dragonflies and damselflies. If you would like to continue your walking in the area then you could follow the Nene Way to Stanwick Lakes and Rushden Lakes for more birdlife and lovely waterside walks.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Fox Inn in Thrapston is a nice place for refreshments after your walk. The friendly pub does good food and has a nice beer garden for warmer weather. You can find the pub on the High Street with a postcode of NN14 4JJ for your sat navs. Head north to Wadenhoe and there's the 17th century King's Head. They have a particularly lovely garden area next to the river where you can watch the boats go by with your meal. You can find the pub at postcode PE8 5ST for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The reserve makes for a nice dog walk but please keep them on leads because of the wildlife. The Fox Inn and King's Head pubs mentioned above are also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles north west of the reserve you'll find Fermyn Woods. This country park has a number of good trails and is a popular spot for dog walking and butterfly spotting. You can pick up the Lyveden Way at Wadenhoe just to the north to visit the park. This fine trail will also take you to the National Trust's Lyveden Estate. Here you'll find a fine Elizabethan lodge and moated garden with a fascinating history. Just to the south you can pick up the Ringstead Circular Walk which explores the pretty Kinewell Lake and the neighbouring villages of Woodford and Denford. For more walking ideas in the area see the Northamptonshire Walks page.

display_address: Mill Lane, Islip, Thrapston, North Northamptonshire, England, NN14 3JN, United Kingdom
